Job Description:

Job Description

Information Technology

This position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.

Title: IT Application Trainer

Overview: The IT Application Trainer (Level 1) will design, develop and maintain implementation training material and methods. The Trainer will support training needs of all functional areas of their integrated applications. The Trainer will understand and translate the functionality of system configuration and workflow validations into organizational specific and easy to understand classroom presentations.

Area of Assignment: Information Technology

Hours of Work: As required to fulfill responsibilities

Responsible to: Supervisor, IT Training

PRE-REQUISITES:

Bachelor's degree preferably in Education, Adult Learning, and/or Instructional Design, OR four years of applicable and demonstrable experience.

Experience in a healthcare organization preferred.

Experience in increasingly responsible, enterprise level, complex business analysis and system development roles preferred.

Preference to candidates with demonstrated ability to use Adobe Captivate or Camtasia.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of adult learning styles.

Demonstrate ability to assess learning needs including cultural assessment as well as skill assessment.

Develop and implement training solutions using a variety of methods, including one-on-one, web-based and classroom training.

Customize out-of-the-box training content to support key business processes as needed.

Ability to work independently and in teams with good problem solving, communication, and organizational skills.

Demonstrated continued professional development in applicable areas.

Demonstrated ability to be self-directed, learn quickly with strong attention to detail.

Proven record of excellent leadership, communications, and organization skills.

Demonstrated ability to work with computer systems and personal computers.

Microsoft Office proficiency is required.

UNIQUE PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKING CONDITIONS: Requires the ability to move PC's and printers weighing up to 40 lbs. Requires planning, organizing and working on multiple tasks at one time. Tolerates ambiguity in instructions and work situations.

PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Generic Job Functions: See Generic Job Description for Administrative Partner

Essential Responsibilities and Competencies:

Obtain applicable training certification(s) or proficiencies and complete all required application training course work, within 6 months.

Provides Manager with a weekly summary of activities.

Partners with Operational leaders to deliver superior business applications training programs to support current and new employees.

Identifies and integrates the business and clinical workflow with the technical capabilities of the Information System and the training programs.

Participates in all aspects of the Information System life cycle - workflow redesign, as well as system design, build, test and implement.

Accountable for in-depth understanding of business/clinical workflow at VMC/VCN and detailed understanding of new workflow objectives and knowledge of how the Information System functionality will support new workflows.

Responsible for assessing training needs of physician, nursing, ancillary care providers, and business operations staff to ensure successful incorporation of new workflows and Policies and Procedures into Information Systems Training programs.

Responsible for developing and testing educational curricula and participant materials to support current and new employees.

Responsible for developing and testing educational curricula and participant materials to support new releases and updates.

Responsible for integration of new workflows into education programs to meet the needs of care providers, business operations staff, project objectives, and organizational goals.

Responsible for classroom instruction, web course development, student evaluations, course completion documentation, and post course feedback follow-up.

Participate in the review/revision/development of business/clinical policies, procedures and charting/documentation standards as needed.

Performs other related duties as required.

Create: 8/17

Grade: 23

FLSA: E

Cost Center: 8551

Company Name: State of Washington Administrative Office of the Courts
Job Description:
Description

Elicit business requirements, provide expert systems analysis services, and assist with quality assurance for statewide systems that support all levels of Washington courts.

Under the general guidance and direction of a manager in the Court Services Division, the Business Analyst works closely with many other business and technical staff at AOC and partner agencies, and with judicial officers, county clerks, court administrators, and other court personnel to elicit and document requirements that support application development, modification, configuration, and testing. This position works independently under general supervision. Decision-making is carried out according to general guidelines and defined rules/procedures, although some areas require interpretation and/or development of possible approaches.

Washington Courts Employment Opportunity
Administrative Office of the Courts

Business Analyst – Blake Refund
Court Services Division

Our Mission: Advance the efficient and effective operation of the Washington Judicial System.

The Administrative Office of the Courts (AOC) is looking for top-performing employees who embody its core values integrity, inclusion, accountability, and teamwork. It is committed to both employee growth and work-life balance.

Our diversity and inclusion efforts include embracing different cultures, backgrounds, and perspectives while fostering growth and advancement in the workplace.

POSITION DETAILS

Job #: 2023-112
Status: PROJECT Funded, Full-Time*
Duration: This is a Blake Implementation project position that is currently funded through June 30, 2025.
Location: Olympia, Washington
Salary: Range 68: $80,112 - $105,096 per year (DOQ).
Opens: November 15, 2023
Closes: November 30, 2023. AOC reserves the right to close the recruitment at any time.

Note: Eligible employees who choose to provide proof of up-to-date COVID-19 vaccination as recommended by the CDC at the point in time when proof is provided (between date of hire and December 31, 2023) will receive a one-time lump sum payment of $1000.

WASHINGTON STATE RESIDENCY AND TELEWORK INFORMATION


AOC requires employees to reside in Washington State. Any exceptions must be approved. If you are invited to interview and currently reside outside of Washington State, seek more information about residency requirements from the AOC hiring manager of this recruitment.


Position may be eligible for hybrid working; a combination of telework and working in-office.

Duties

Plan, schedule and lead the management of requirements for complex solutions.
Elicit business requirements from internal and external subject matter experts.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and technical personnel to ensure that business needs are clearly defined, understood and translated into technical solutions.
Translate business requirements into user stories, use cases and acceptance criteria
Develop and maintain requirements documentation.
Develop and maintain requirements traceability matrices for requirement management and re-use.
Analyze requirements for completeness and testability.
Review test results to confirm that test acceptance criteria have been met.
Provide consultation to project stakeholders.
Conduct intensive, in-depth systems analysis for new or enhancements for small to large and highly complex applications and systems.

Qualifications



Master's degree in computer science, information systems or related technical/business discipline AND one (1) year of direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.

OR


Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or related technical/business discipline AND four (4) years of information technology experience including direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.

OR


Associate’s degree in computer science, information systems or related technical/business discipline AND six (6) years of information technology experience including direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.

OR


Eight (8) years of information technology experience which includes three (3) years of direct experience as a business analyst and/or court user subject matter expert performing business analysis functions such as conducting requirements gathering activities with stakeholders, analyzing and evaluating business functions/processes for deficiencies and enhancements, and recommending solutions to address business needs.


*Relative IT Experience includes systems and software requirements development and management, software or systems development following the software development lifecycle and project management practices.

THE IDEAL APPLICANT WILL ALSO HAVE SOME OR ALL OF THE FOLLOWING EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES


Demonstrated ability in and aptitude for planning, requirements elicitation and managing requirements for complex solutions.
Demonstrated expert level ability in and knowledge of, requirement management methodologies, tools and processes.
Demonstrated expert level ability in and aptitude for, requirement elicitation and documentation.
Experience in, and aptitude for translating business requirements into user stories or use cases.
Ability to plan and organize assignments to create timely, accurate work products.
Ability to work efficiently, remain focused, and handle interruptions effectively.
Strong technical analytical skills with proven documentation of analysis and recommendations.
Expertise in, and aptitude for, presentation, interpersonal, written and oral communication when communication with business and technical audiences.
Strong written and communication skills.
Consistent demonstration of AOC Values - Integrity, Teamwork, Customer Service, Honesty, Communication, Respect, Accountability and Trust.

Supplemental Information

For more information about the position, to review the job description, application submission requirements, supplemental questions, inquire about benefits, or to apply for the position: CLICK HER TO APPLY.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION


The workweek may fluctuate depending on workload or agency needs.
Overnight travel may be required based on business needs.
This position is not overtime eligible.
The AOC is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on gender, pregnancy, race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, creed, physical, mental or sensory disability (actual or perceived), use of a service animal, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, age, HIV or Hepatitis C status, or any other basis protected by federal or state law. Persons of disability needing assistance in the application process, or those needing this announcement in an alternative format, please contact the AOC Human Resource Office, at (360) 705-5337, or fax (360) 586-4409, or via email to Recruitment@courts.wa.gov.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

SPECIAL NOTE: Before a new hire, a background check, including criminal history, will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the job.

Company Name: State of Washington Dept. of Transportation
Job Description:
Description





About WSDOT
Washington State Department of Transportation (WSDOT) is the steward of an integrated, multimodal transportation system that helps to ensure people and goods move safely and efficiently throughout the state. In addition to building, maintaining, and operating the state highway system, WSDOT operates the largest ferry system in the nation, manages the world's longest floating bridge, and recently completed the world's widest tunneling project.

The Opportunity
WSDOT is currently seeking a Transportation Planning Specialist 4 to serve as the Business and Systems Analyst. This position is the senior technical expert for programming over $600 million in operating, capital construction and capital equipment projects in the various Washington State Department of Transportation (WSDOT), state and federal systems. This position develops business procedures and processes to ensure eligibility under each grant program. The position plays a key role in the Department’s state budget building process. This role extends to ensuring funds are assigned and authorized as appropriate for each grantee and each project, payments are made in a timely manner, WSDOT’s budget and accounting systems are updated with each budget cycle, all financial planning and reporting elements are coordinated though the Public Transportation Grant Management System (GMS). Our top candidate will have broad experience and professional expertise in the various areas of public transportation.

What to Expect
This position requires expertise across a range of challenging areas including in-depth knowledge of state budgeting process, and in-depth understanding of federal and state laws and regulations. This position plays a key role in the funding, programming, and delivery of operating and capital projects under the WSDOT’s Public Transportation Division and assists in state budget planning, allotment preparation, decision package creation, and reporting on budget and financial processes. The position will have a firm grasp of state budget cycles, allowable costs, subrecipient monitoring, reporting, matching, period of performance, procurement, and cash management. The position will demonstrate knowledge and ability to program projects in the Public Transportation Division’s Grants Management System.

Among the varied range of responsibilities held within this role, the Business and Systems Analyst will:



Serve as a liaison to other agency divisions, such as Budget and Accounting. Review and approve invoices, prepare journal vouchers and other budget documents, and reports as requested.
Ensure timely submittal of supplemental and biennium budgets as directed by the Office of Financial Management.
Perform adequate review of fiscal notes, and newly introduced bills by the Legislature.
Prepare allotment plans and provide updates as needed to the WSDOT Central Budget Office.
Connect with grantees for feedback and input, and independently make decisions and define the best alternative/path to better serve the stakeholders and address their needs.
Ensure timely programming of appropriations of state funds in TRAINS and the GMS.
Ensure the integrity of the data within GMS and alignment with WSDOT’s internal systems and grantees’ external systems.
Work on strategies to ensure deadlines are met and data is auditable, eliminating the risk of losing state and federal funds due to noncompliance.
Oversee labor planning, and reporting, including cost allocation plans and labor distribution.
Participate in state and federal audits, coordinating the effort with division staff and other agency offices/divisions.
Manage staff and engage teams to develop capabilities, improve efficiency and enhance capacity to support agency and partner goals.

Qualifications
To be considered for this opportunity, at least one (1) of the following are required:

Two (2) years as a Transportation Planning Specialist 3, Transportation Engineer 3, Landscape Designer 3, or equivalent classification in city or county agencies. OR
A bachelor's degree involving major study in transportation, environmental or urban, regional or land use planning, engineering, public or business administration, economics or natural or physical sciences and four (4) years of professional grants management experience involving analysis and evaluation of issues and problems. OR
A Master's degree in one of the above fields and three (3) years of professional grants management experience involving analysis and evaluation of issues and problems.

It is preferred that qualified candidates also have:

General knowledge of best practices, industry standards, regulatory agency rules, and agency policies and procedures related to public transportation industry.
Firm grasp of 2 CFR 200 in terms of allowable costs, subrecipient monitoring, reporting, matching, period of performance, procurement, and cash management.
Experience working with state and federal audits.
Experience performing oversight and compliance functions.
Experience with state budgeting process, including labor forecasting and management.
Ability to use and learn new systems.
Knowledge of state and federal public transportation grant processes and subsequent state and federal requirements and regulations.
Experience with strategic thinking when planning-ahead or dealing with complex problems.
Demonstrated ability to use knowledge and diplomacy when working with subrecipients and dealing with different point of views regarding new processes and guidelines.

To review the full Position Description, please follow the directions in the Contact Us section of this posting.

Important Notes

In addition to base salary, employees may be entitled to other forms of compensation depending on the type, duties, or location of the position. For union-represented positions, more information on other forms of compensation can be found in the applicable Collective Bargaining Agreements. Information on other compensation types for non-represented positions can be found in Chapter 357-28 of the Washington Administrative Code.
This position offers flexible/hybrid remote work options.
The recruiting efforts for this position may be extended beyond the displayed closing date for as long and until a sufficient candidate pool has been established. However, the first review of applications will be conducted December 5, 2023. The Appointing Authority reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any time thereafter. It is to your benefit to submit your application as soon as possible.
WSDOT does not use the E-Verify system, therefore we are not eligible to extend STEM Optional Practical Training (OPT). For more information, please visit www.uscis.wa.gov.

Why WSDOT

Work-Life Balance – We are committed to ensure that our staff experience the reward of public service, while also sustaining a routine that suits each individuals’ lifestyle. As such, there are a number of flexible schedule options available, including occasional telework for eligible positions.
Paid Leave – In addition to 12 paid holidays, full-time employees may earn up to 25 paid vacation days per year!
Tuition Assistance – Permanent employees have several options for assistance with education expenses, including tuition reimbursement programs, government discounts at participating colleges throughout the state, and eligibility for federal student loan forgiveness.
Plan For Your Future – WSDOT offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes a variety of healthcare options. Employees also have their choice of state retirement programs, and much more. Go to State Benefits for more information.

Check out this video to learn more: Why WSDOT?

How to Apply
Applications for this recruitment will be accepted electronically. Your relevant experience may be evaluated to determine salary. Therefore, it is very important that the “Work Experience” portion of the application be completed in as much detail as possible.
In order to be considered for this opportunity, please include the following with your online application:

An attached Resume outlining (in reverse chronological order) your experience to date.
An attached Cover Letter that further explains your qualifications and indicates why you believe you are a viable candidate for this role.
Contact details for a minimum of three (3) individuals who can attest to your work performance, technical skills, and job-related competencies. NOTE: This information may be entered in the “References” section of the online application; does not require an additional attachment.

Please click the "APPLY" button to proceed. Note that you will be prompted to either sign in or create an account. This step is required in order to submit an application to this opportunity.

WSDOT is an equal opportunity employer. We value the importance of creating an environment in which all employees can feel respected, included, and empowered to bring unique ideas to the agency. Our diversity and inclusion efforts include embracing different cultures, backgrounds and viewpoints while fostering growth and advancement in the workplace. All persons, regardless of race, ethnicity, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, and/or gender identity, are encouraged to apply. Persons with disabilities needing assistance in the application process, or those needing this job announcement in an alternative format may contact the listed Recruiter via email.

Contact Us
For inquiries about this posting, you may contact the assigned Recruiter, Robyn Lovely at Robyn.Lovely@wsdot.wa.gov. Please be sure to reference 23DOT-HQ-04599 in the subject line.

Company Description


When you join Turnitin, you'll be welcomed into a company that is a recognized innovator in the global education space. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Over 16,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Gradescope by Turnitin, iThenticate, Turnitin Feedback Studio, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity, ExamSoft, Ouriginal and ProctorExam.

Turnitin has offices in Australia, India, Indonesia, Germany, Japan, Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Sweden, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Our diverse community of colleagues are all unified by a shared desire to make a difference in education. Come join us, and let's make change together.



Job Description


Turnitin is a pioneer in education technology with its roots in academic integrity, delivering flexible assessment solutions to higher education institutions, high schools, and graduate programs. Turnitin is building innovative new products for the next decade of education. We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst II.

The purpose of this role is to drive analytics and support the implementation of key organizational initiatives where data are integral to Product usage and health. You’ll work cross-functionally and collaboratively with Portfolio Strategy, User Experience, Product Marketing, Sales, Customer Support, Tech, and other teams to define data requirements; collect and process data; develop data models; conduct analyses, visualize, and provide reporting. As part of Product Strategy Operations, you’ll increase efficiency and automation of data analysis processes.

Key Responsibilities and Outputs

Gather, organize, and analyze data across products, programs, and teams
Document data and identify gaps in data across different products
Monitor and maintain data quality and integrity within the Product BI infrastructure
Use data analysis tools to draw insights and create recommendations that improve Product Strategy Operations and Product Management
Gather feedback and enhance Product Strategy Operations assets including but not limited to BI workflows, roadmaps, and standard operating procedures
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis, and reporting
Train and support users on new and modified data systems and reporting
Stay up-to-date on the latest developments in the education market, for teaching and learning, and related to product operations and program management


Qualifications

2+ years of experience with data analytics, impact evaluation, or related fields
Proficiency in data analysis tools and formats such as SQL, Excel, and Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience dealing with large (1+ million-row) datasets
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team

Preferred Qualifications

Master's degree in business analytics, information management, or a related field
Experience with Gainsight, Salesforce, and Alteryx, DBT, or other ETL tools

Additional Information


The expected annual base salary range for this position is: $83,339/year to $125,009/year. This position is bonus eligible / commission-based.
As a Remote-First company, actual compensation will be provided in writing at the time of offer, if extended, and is determined by work location and a range of other relevant factors, including but not limited to: experience, skills, degrees, licensures, certifications, and other job-related factors. Internal equity, market and organizational factors are also considered.

Total Rewards @ Turnitin
Turnitin maintains a Total Rewards package that is competitive within the local job market. People tend to think about their Total Rewards monetarily — solely as regular pay plus bonus or commission. This is what they earn in exchange for what they do. However, Turnitin delivers more than just these components. Beyond the intrinsic rewards of making a difference in the lives of educators, administrators, learners and researchers around the world, and thriving in an organization that is free of politics and full of humble, inclusive and collaborative teammates, the extrinsic rewards at Turnitin include generous time off and health and wellness programs that offer choice and flexibility and provide a safety net for the challenges that life presents from time to time. In our Remote-First approach to collaborating, you are also able to work the way that best fits your style and situation - whether that be remote, in one of our offices/rented spaces, or hybrid.

Our Mission is to ensure the integrity of global education and meaningfully improve learning outcomes.

Our Values underpin everything we do.

Customer Centric - We realize our mission to ensure integrity and improve learning outcomes by putting educators and learners at the center of everything we do.
Passion for Learning - We seek out teammates that are constantly learning and growing and build a workplace which enables them to do so.
Integrity - We believe integrity is the heartbeat of Turnitin. It shapes our products, the way we treat each other, and how we work with our customers and vendors.
Action & Ownership - We have a bias toward action and empower teammates to make decisions.
One Team - We strive to break down silos, collaborate effectively, and celebrate each other’s successes.
Global Mindset - We respect local cultures and embrace diversity. We think globally and act locally to maximize our impact on education.

Global Benefits

Flexible/hybrid working
Remote First Culture
Health Care Coverage*
Tuition Reimbursement*
Competitive Paid Time Off
4 Self-Care Days per year
National Holidays*
2 Founder Days + Juneteenth Observed
Paid Volunteer Time*
Charitable contribution match*
Monthly Wellness Reimbursement/Home Office Equipment*
Access to Modern Health (mental health platform)
Parental Leave*
Retirement Plan with match/contribution*
varies by country

Seeing Beyond the Job Ad

At Turnitin, we recognize it’s unrealistic for candidates to fulfill 100% of the criteria in a job ad. We encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of the requirements because we know that skills evolve over time. If you’re willing to learn and evolve alongside us, join our team!

Turnitin, LLC is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities and employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

This role is HYBRID, 3 Days a week at our UL Vancouver Office.

Assists with the definition and development of user-friendly reports and graphics that integrate and convey complex data/information and maintains data catalog to provide key data sources to internal and external stakeholders.
Conducts in-depth data analyses using traditional and advanced statistical methods.
Works within established guidelines and policy.
Aggregates data to test hypotheses, prepares and analyzes data to meet the needs of efficient data analysis, using technical experience and judgement.
Assists with developing programming solutions to conduct data preparation, analysis and visualization in support of statistical modeling, data analytics and interpretation.
Transforms complex data into creative graphs, tables, charts and other graphics in order to present and/or share the data in a comprehensive and concise manner.
Assesses trends and provides analysis to identify emerging business critical issues. Identifies and defines opportunities for safety solutions by analyzing historical patterns.
Assists in defining, developing and deploying data, analytics and reporting products and services.
Conducts data validation, statistical analyses, and data mapping.
Read and follow the Underwriters Laboratories Code of Conduct and follow all physical and digital security practices.
Performs other duties as directed.




University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelors degree) in Mathematics, Statistics, Finance or a related discipline and generally three plus years of experience in data and statistical analysis strongly preferred.
Strong in Microsoft Excel and Power BI, data management and data integration skills with an ability to organize, analyze and correlate data information.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous experience doing large scale data analysis preferred.
Ability to organize, analyze and correlate data information.


Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 129 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.
People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best.
Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.
Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.
Total Rewards: The salary range for this position is $50,000-$70,000 of the salary range and is based upon years of experience that is commensurate with the level of the position.

All employees at UL Solutions are eligible for annual bonus compensation. The target for this position is 10% of the base salary offered. Employees are eligible for health benefits such as medical, dental and vision; wellness benefits such as mental & financial health; and retirement savings (401K) commensurate with the standard rewards offered in each individual location or country, for the relevant position level.

We also provide employees with paid time off including vacation (15 days), holiday including floating holidays (12 days) and sick time off (72 hours).

Internal applicants with questions related to the Total Rewards for this position should submit a ticket via askHR for more insights.

Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.

Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com.

A global leader in applied safety science, UL Solutions transforms safety, security, and sustainability challenges into opportunities for customers in more than 100 countries. UL Solutions delivers testing, inspection and certification services, together with software products and advisory offerings, that support our customers’ product innovation and business growth.

The UL Certification Marks serve as a recognized symbol of trust in our customers’ products and reflect an unwavering commitment to advancing our safety mission.

We help our customers innovate, launch new products and services, navigate global markets and complex supply chains, and grow sustainably and responsibly into the future.

From the adoption of electrification to the enablement of 5G and new mobility, we collectively look toward new frontiers, working for a safer world. Our science is your advantage.

Mission: Working for a safer world


We solve our customers’ problems. "Helping clients meet their safety and performance goals means understanding their business processes from start to finish and not just focusing on project parameters." UL Solutions’ Software & Advisory (S&A) services help customers reduce complexity, ensure compliance, improve quality and operational performance, and drive sustainability.

Description

At Providence, our vision — health for a better world — is driven by the belief that health is a human right. That’s why we’re creating the health system of the future. Through our clinical practices and research network, our commitment to health equity, and our investments in new information technology, we’re promoting the conditions for better health and nurturing new solutions to chronic health problems.

The Providence Development Program is a program that will offer the opportunity to work in four different job assignments within Supply Chain Management. Each assignment will last for a period of six months, opportunities offered fall within the below listed job functions:

Materials Management
Inventory Management
Sourcing
Contracting
Business Operations
Procurement

This program is designed to provide each individual the opportunity to have in-depth development experiences across a range of business areas. Each specific job assignment will provide an opportunity to maximize your learning and development and will give you access to a variety of training and activities.

To qualify for this program you must meet the following criteria:

A college student at a 4 year College who will be graduating between December 2023 - June 2024 with a Bachelor's Degree in one of the following areas of study:
Supply Chain Management
Statistics
Computer Science
Information Systems
Business Administration
Data Analysis
Business Analysis
GPA Requirement: 3.2 or Higher
Demonstrated Analytical, leadership and problem solving skills
Excellent Verbal and Written Communication skills

This is a two year program that will run between July 2024 and June 2026. Upon completion of the program, participants are eligible to apply for regular full time opportunities within Providence.

Providence is calling a Supply Chain Analyst who will be given the opportunity to experience a variety of job functions within Supply Chain Management.

Job duties and responsibilities will include:

Supporting data analytics for daily, monthly, and annual operating metrics and dashboards
Supporting negotiations and monitoring compliance for system-wide contracts
Analyzing contract utilization and proposal data, and formulating recommendations
Analyzing and comprehend large amounts of data
Creating basic to complex reports, charts, and graphs from various sources of information
Facilitate discussions with decision-making individuals
Leverage data mining tools and techniques to create and manage databases
Build reporting tools, including regular scheduled KPIs
Build and monitor a database of auto-generating reports
Utilize data analytics to decipher data trends and variances
Creating summary reports for leadership

This posting is for multiple openings of a Supply Chain Analyst. Providence welcomes remote work for residents living within a daily commutable distance of our office / hospital locations listed below:

Washington (Puget Sound Region): Everett, Seattle, Issaquah, Renton, Olympia
Southern California : Burbank, Los Angeles, Fullerton, Orange, Irvine, Mission Viejo, Apple Valley

Note: There will be a 6-12 week rotation that will require for you to report into a hospital location, close to your home address, daily as scheduled.

Required qualifications for this position include:

Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, Data Analysis, Business Analysis
2+ years' experience in: Analytics, reporting or other related work experience, demonstrated strong analytical and organization skills (or equivalency), planning efficient and accurate procedures, schedules, systems to accomplish information and database information management functions in support of activities and programs
A track record in quickly acquiring a good understanding of the organization, its business imperatives and reporting needs
A track record in organizing and planning with a proven ability to effectively manage time, multi-task, and achieve results in a fast paced environment with competing business priorities
Demonstrated customer focus with a track record in building and maintaining regular communication and feedback channels

Preferred qualifications for this position include:

Materials management, operations or group purchasing environment experience

WA: (Puget Sound, Vancouver)

Min: $32.33
Max: $52.19

Southern California:

Min: $33.70
Max: $54.40

Why Join Providence?

Our best-in-class benefits are uniquely designed to support you and your family in staying well, growing professionally and achieving financial security. We take care of you, so you can focus on delivering our Mission of caring for everyone, especially the most vulnerable in our communities.

About Providence

At Providence, our strength lies in Our Promise of “Know me, care for me, ease my way.” Working at our family of organizations means that regardless of your role, we’ll walk alongside you in your career, supporting you so you can support others. We provide best-in-class benefits and we foster an inclusive workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone is essential, heard and respected. Together, our 120,000 caregivers (all employees) serve in over 50 hospitals, over 1,000 clinics and a full range of health and social services across Alaska, California, Montana, New Mexico, Oregon, Texas and Washington. As a comprehensive health care organization, we are serving more people, advancing best practices and continuing our more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable.

The information described in this job description has been designed to indicate the general nature of the work performed. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Other information:

Job Summary
The Senior Application Analyst serves as a mentor to their application teams. They have advanced analytical expertise, with comprehensive knowledge of all components of their application(s), including: database architecture, user interface design, background processes, logic and rules constructs, reporting, and other features. In demonstrating these capabilities and the integration of their applications with others, they can expand their awareness of the functions and design of other applications. Senior analysts have robust and durable relationships with their business partners and stakeholders, and work with them to instrument solutions that are broader and more complex in scope. Though not line managers, their success is driven by their ability to provide multi-layered knowledge of wider systems and applications. They are influencers, enabling them to lead small projects and to collaborate with others within IS and the organization. In addition to being expert on their assigned applications, Senior Analysts have broader familiarity with other applications and technologies they can use to develop solutions or lead inter-application team endeavors. Senior analysts must understand data and workflow integration, knowing how key functions of applications are interconnected. They serve as mentors to analysts, through coaching, demonstration and tutoring. They add value to their assigned duties, by enhancing application functions, advancing the skills of their teams and provide better service and products for their stakeholders.

Essential Functions
Application Design, Development and Validation: 1) Demonstrate application/business analysis skills by understanding all relevant data, processes or information relative to a problem/design, identify the relationships between these points and evaluate the impacts a design/change imparts on users, other applications, etc. 2) Document current and proposed data flows within your application(s) as well as with other systems or interfaces. 3) Exhibit the ability to: define the plan of work, discover current data elements and possibilities, assess those elements and possibilities, and create a written specifications/requirements. 4) Collaborate/work with stakeholders and customers to identify and document key business requirements for application. 5) Develop application functionality to address user requirements and that integrates well with other components/functions of the application. 6) Gain an understanding of all relevant data and event interfaces between assigned applications and other applications it interacts with regularly. Quality Assurance/Testing: 1) Understands and coordinates with other individuals and analysts for testing functions including unit testing, integration testing and interface testing. 2) Can independently build and execute a test plan. Communication and Documentation: 1) Capably share and articulate your application design and requirements findings with your peers, stakeholders/customers and managers. 2) Effectively tailors communication for the audience; articulates technical issues in a clear and concise manner. 3) Produces written documentation that records proposed design and changes for peers and customers. 4) Regularly initiates and communicates issues and concerns to stakeholders, peers and managers. 5) Utilize established document structures and tools to create requirements documents, tip sheets and other materials. Technology Foundation: 1) Addresses hardware needs and engages appropriate teams to troubleshoot hardware peripherals. 2) Follows established change management, maintenance and upgrade processes. 3) Understand planned and unplanned downtime procedures. 4) Requests vendor changes and support of application per policies. Application Support and Maintenance 1) Participate in end user downtime activities, both preparatory and actual downtime events, developing tools and support structures to enable users to utilize manual processes and then migrate back to the application when online. 2) Monitor all issue and service request tickets, including meeting service level agreements for communication and closure via service level agreements; this includes a regular review and prioritization of issues weekly or via another identified time standard. 3) Provide after hours and weekend on call support services as required for assigned application(s). 4) Provide mechanisms for user reporting of application and system deficiencies as well as system improvements. 5) Assure application changes impacting user workflows are communicated and understood by recipients. 6) Provide customer service by exhibiting empathy, patience, respect and a positive attitude; actively listen to customer concerns and address them honestly and objectively. Vendor Management: 1) Communicate with application vendor on issues requiring their support or intervention Application Maintenance: 1) Be knowledgeable of all system environments associated with application, their purpose and when they are updated/changed. 3. Performance Improvement and Project Management 1) Able to work with stakeholders and other IS staff to translate business needs into technical/application specifications and configuration. 1) Utilize tools and processes to identify, report and resolve issues and risks 2) Participate in user oversight committees/workgroups as requested, completing any assigned tasks. 3) Report progress on your assigned tasks 4. Other Duties: 1) Participate in on call rotations on nights and weekends. 2) Other duties as assigned.

Education
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business management or a clinical profession (nursing, laboratory science, pharmacy, etc.) preferred.

Experience/Training
Serving in an analyst or computer system support (five years) preferred. Experience in and knowledge of health system operations (five years) preferred.

License/Certifications
a. Must maintain Epic certification, required within ninety (90) days of completing training for certification testing, employees will be given three chances to pass each certification test. Application coordinators will gain in-depth knowledge of software by attending training at Epic and completing application certification projects and tests. b. Epic team resources should possess proficiencies in other applications, particularly those relevant to their function (preferred)

Other Skills
The senior analyst has advanced problem solving skills and critical thinking talents that provide for objective analysis and evaluation of an issue or idea. Senior analysts: a. Account for root cause analysis investigations to identify causes, define recovery processes and improve reliability. b. Anticipate the information needs of customers, managers or others in organization. c. Mentor others in critical thinking, troubleshooting techniques and cross team collaboration. d. Understand the logical connection between ideas and functions. The senior analyst is results-oriented and drives to meet target outcomes that address the needs of their stakeholders, managers and peers. a. They are able to define successful outcomes for their assigned projects. b. They demonstrate self-motivation, able to independently manage their workloads and priorities. Leadership and planning are fundamental capabilities of senior analysts; they must coach and guide others as well as organize, structure and facilitate cross-application projects and enhancements. Here, they will: a. Compose and monitor project plans for small projects. Effectively communicating – both orally and in writing – are focal to senior analyst success; they must be able to define and articulate their messages to a variety of audiences in a professional manner. a. Produce effective documentation and materials, including: cross-application status reporting, professional quality documents to share with customers and escalation of issues to leadership. b. Communicate effectively with high level stakeholders by providing a concise and balanced perspective of the opportunities and risks. Senior analysts should organize and plan how they and their team members divide their time between specific activities: This includes: a. Managing multiple projects simultaneously, and able to quickly reposition this work without delays.

Physical Demands and Work Environment
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for long periods of time; when working in office. Repetitive tasks such as typing, sitting, answering phones, and interacting with computers and computer systems most of the day is a function of the position. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to focus. This position requires working in an indoor, environmentally controlled environment when in the office. Eligible employees also receive sick time pay.

Our client, a leading Pacific Northwest utility provider committed to public service and environmental preservation, is looking for a Senior Systems Analyst for their Vancouver, Washington location. This position performs process, controls, and systems analysis; interfacing with users to support functional requirements development, analysis of tools and techniques to support the development of processes, systems, and controls; troubleshooting, analysis, performance monitoring and improvement of processes, systems, and controls used by and/or in support of client’s TE Reliability Standards Owner (RSO) Program and the Transmission Engineering Application and Standards (TEV) organization.

This hybrid position is a one-year renewable contract. If you think you’d be a good fit, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities for Senior Business Systems Analyst:

Supporting Requirements Development:

Conduct interviews and facilitate workshops to elicit business requirements.
Research, analyze, model, and organize information for developing requirements.
Decompose high-level information and abstract up from low-level information to distinguish solution ideas from business needs.
Facilitate requirements validation sessions and present findings to client management and other stakeholders.
Collaborate to resolve requirements conflicts between stakeholders.
Research, document, and validate current and future state processes and designs (functional and technical).
Help define best approaches, alternatives, and decision frameworks for alternative business solutions analyses.

Solution Development and Proposal:

Facilitate design sessions, key decisions, team meetings, sponsor meetings, and stakeholder engagement sessions.
Design architecture and solutions based on requirements and best practices.
Facilitate/assist in technical process improvement initiatives.
Research and develop methods to automate repetitive manual data manipulations.
Assist teams in defining solution delivery within multiple sprints and releases within a project.
Draft solutions that integrate the various Portfolio, Project, and Asset Management systems.
Complete all documentation in support of the solution, including use cases, requirements, test plans, process maps, and desk procedures.

10 years of experience is required with an applicable associate degree.
12 years of experience is required without a degree.
Experience should include business systems analysis with a focus in process development in and for a regulatory/regulated business environment. Expert level practitioner in business systems analysis and/or systems analysis.
Advanced knowledge of Visio or other similar flowchart tools.
Advanced proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, charting, and reporting.

Expert knowledge in IT planning, functional and technical specifications, and system life cycle (SLC) management.
Experience with using SharePoint and MS Project.

Now Brewing – business analysis manager, Logistics Finance! #tobeapartner


From the beginning, Starbucks set out to be a different kind of company. One that not only celebrated coffee and the rich tradition, but that also brought a feeling of connection. We are known for developing extraordinary leaders who share this passion and are guided by their service to others.


Starbucks Logistics Finance is seeking a business analysis manager to drive business case development and elevated insights & analytics in support of our Distribution centers. This role is heavily project-based and contributes to Starbucks success by performing highly complex financial models used for decision support and partnering cross-functionally to execute value-add projects. Additionally, the business analysis manager will be responsible for designing solutions and making recommendations, with clear communication to senior leaders and relevant stakeholders.


As a business analysis manager – Logistics Finance, you will…


Support and influence decision making through month-end, forecast, annual budget, and
strategic planning processes. Identify trends, communicate observations and provide recommendations for cost and margin improvements.
Drive Solutions and Recommendations: You will be responsible for leading various projects
and business cases focused on strategic enablement and process improvement
You will work with various cross-functional teams to set financial targets/guardrails, develop
plans, conduct analyses, measure results, and improve/create new processes.
Creatively Solutioning to Solve Complex Cross-Functional Problems: You will need to develop
innovative solutions and drive best practices across the organization.
Utilize Analytical Skills to Identify Areas for Improvement: You will be required to utilize various
financial and operational analytical skills to identify gaps and potential process improvement areas. You will analyze identified gaps / issues to determine impact to the business.
Effectively Communicate Results to Leadership: You will be responsible for synthesizing financial
and operational information and clearly communicating to all levels of management.

Progressive experience in financial analysis, modeling, reporting, budgeting, business planning, and business cases – 7 years

Project management experience – 5 years

This role is responsible for providing direction and guidance to staff in process improvement endeavors, technology implementations, and strategic initiatives. This includes training in work procedures and principles, providing oversight of process documentation and analysis, utilizing performance reports to identify areas for improvement, and devising and recommending remediation plans.

This position serves as a department expert for Customer Services Applications. The successful candidate will serve as a release manager and liaison to the Information Technology department and vendors on technology projects, creating plans that include change assessment, build test packages and manage defects from verification to resolution, and provide or coordinate final approval.

Department Specific Tools and Technology

Identify test scenarios that are candidates for test automation through Worksoft
Engineer and develop test automation to improve accuracy and speed of technology upgrades and implementations to reduce manual workloads and reduce time to deployment
Achieve Subject Matter Expert status with department specific technology and applications
Conduct troubleshooting of assigned applications, documentation of defects and resolution tracking

Serve as SAP EPIC member to document, evaluate and submit IDEA work orders to SAP changes or enhancements
Facilitate requirements gathering and documentation for technology initiatives
Analyze requests and requirements to determine ancillary impacts to existing or proposed processes and works with requestor to find optimized solutions
Complete required documentation and impact assessments; identify and assign work to proper departments and channels for resolution
Process Improvement and Workflow Audits
Facilitate workshops with business partners to document workflows and business processes with a focus on pain points and inefficiencies
Lead associate and intermediate level analysts, cross functional teams and impacted groups to identify solutions, increase efficiency, enhance accuracy, and improve customer or end user experiences
Analyze internal departmental tasks and processes to identify and target improvements in accuracy, efficiency, and efficacy
Technology Upgrades and Implementation
Lead internal and cross department functional teams in conducting GAP analysis and research into business processes
Identify and prioritize routine, abnormal and complex test scenarios
Direct assigned analytical resources in reporting, documenting and tracking defects

Job Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst (Digital Asset Management)
Job Description:
Get to know The Pokémon Company International




The Pokémon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokémon Company in Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand management, licensing, marketing, the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the animated TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokémon website. Pokémon was launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's entertainment properties in the world.




Learn more online at Corporate.Pokemon.com and Pokemon.com. And check out Twitter (twitter.com/Pokemon), LinkedIn (linkedin.com/company/Pokémon), Youtube (youtube.com/pokemon), and Instagram (instagram.com/pokemon).



Get to know the role




Job Title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst Role

Job Summary:

As the Senior Business Systems Analyst in our Product Program, you will be responsible for a mix of project management, application administration, process optimization, business analysis, and production support. This role will be involved in solution selection, business process evaluation and optimization, solution implementation and providing support for Digital Asset Management applications utilized by internal and external stakeholders. The ideal candidate has experience working with the creation, editing, cataloging, and sharing of digital assets. Experience working with Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), Digital Asset Management (DAM), Project/Portfolio Management (PPM), and familiarity with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Product Information Management (PIM) solutions is preferred. This role will maintain a comprehensive understanding of current and future needs of the Product program by working directly with stakeholders and in partnership with the Product Program Manager and IT Leadership. The Sr. BSA will serve as a subject matter expert for cross-functional projects and upstream/downstream systems, with the first major project to aid in solution selection and implementation of a Digital Asset Management system.

FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt
People Manager: No




What you’ll do




Ensure systems that support your end users are reliable, adopted, remain relevant and seamlessly support evolving business processes. This includes sourcing, configuring, implementing, maintaining, upgrading, integrating, providing training for and monitoring applications.
Conduct a variety of workshops such as: joint application development, design thinking, requirements gathering, mind mapping, value stream mapping, etc.
Perform discovery gap analyses, process design, requirements gathering, source to target mapping and data analyses, data cleansing and data migration activities.
Author diverse documentation, including business process flow diagrams, system context diagrams, value stream maps, user stories, end-to-end test scenarios, knowledge base articles and training materials.
Collaborate effectively and efficiently with developers, stakeholders, and leaders during various stages of development including designing, configuration/coding, testing, deploying, maintaining.
Serve as a subject matter expert for cross-functional projects and upstream/downstream systems.
Identify opportunities for process improvement to increase output, raise quality and reduce cost.
Work independently to drive time, scope and budget, testing, implementation, risk, and change management.



What you’ll bring




8+ years of professional experience supporting or as part of a creative team developing digital assets.
5+ years relevant experience working with business units to optimize the usage of DAM within the enterprise.
5+ years relevant experience administrating, monitoring, reporting against and troubleshooting DAM systems.
Strong Digital Asset Management (DAM) experience from concept to release and through end of life.
Experience with stakeholders in different time zones and multiple go-to market pillars.
Experience with Agile/iterative development methodologies and tools (Jira, Jira Service Desk) preferred.
Familiarity with other business systems such as: PIM, MAM, DAM, ERP CRM, RPA, low-code application platforms, SharePoint, Confluence, etc.



How you’ll be successful




Passion for Pokémon: Develops an understanding of the Pokémon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a “team first” mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Work Location: In person

The Foundation
We are the largest nonprofit fighting poverty, disease, and inequity around the world. Founded on a simple premise: people everywhere, regardless of identity or circumstances, should have the chance to live healthy, productive lives. We believe our employees should reflect the rich diversity of the global populations we aim to serve. We provide an exceptional benefits package to employees and their families which include comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage with no premiums, generous paid time off, paid family leave, foundation-paid retirement contribution, regional holidays, and opportunities to engage in several employee communities. As a workplace, we’re committed to creating an environment for you to thrive both personally and professionally.
The Team
The vision of Global Financial & Accounting Services (GFAS) is to provide innovative and scalable global business solutions in accounting, tax, payroll, treasury, procurement and financial operations while safeguarding the reputation of the foundation and our related entities, with the highest standards of integrity and operational excellence.

GFAS is a division within the Finance organization at the foundation and an important part of the operations function. Operations supports and enables the six program teams to make investments and to run effectively and efficiently. As a function, Finance employs approximately 100 FTEs. The GFAS division is significant (40+ FTE’s), and responsible for financial reporting processes, technical and advisory services, internal controls, vendor due diligence and the accounting functions at the foundation.
Your Role
As a new integral function of GFAS, Strategic Sourcing & Procurement (SS&P) is building up a team that partners with business to procure competitive vendors, drive negotiations and align with internal contracting requirements. SS&P is both a practice and function.
As a practice, SS&P is the evaluation and selection of vendors based on qualitative and measurable success metrics, rather than the simple cost of the product or service. SS&P connects spend analysis, data-driven vendor selection with diversity in mind, and ongoing engagement with vendors to increase purchasing power to deliver value and mitigate risk.
As a function, SS&P is a new business-enabling team who partners with Contract Services, Finance, Information Security, HR, Legal, Accounting and others to ensure our vendor procurement process is transparent, balances risk, and gives time back to business partners to focus on their impactful work in the foundation.
Reporting to the Operations Lead of SS&P, the Procurement Operations Analyst will join a team whose primary responsibilities include strategic sourcing, vendor management, and managing all procurement processes across all Operational Divisions. This Analyst will support all procurement activities, including performance & metrics reporting, in the new Coupa procurement platform, and collaborate with due diligence partners to manage vendor onboarding process to ensure compliance and efficiency.
What You’ll Do
Support across Operation functions (i.e., Finance, HR, IT etc), regional offices and affiliates in a variety of purchasing functions in compliance with the foundation Global Procurement guidelines.
Assist purchase requestors across the foundation in understanding the procurement process and navigating the Coupa procurement system.
Support transactions from Request intake to Purchase Order approval to ensure accuracy, quality assurance, purchasing spend approvals and timeliness to compliance of guidelines.
Manage new vendor onboarding effectively by partnering with Sourcing team and collaborate with other partners: AP (bank routing, TIN check), Legal (Conflict of Interest and OFAC), GCS (Contract compliance check) to ensure timely & compliant vendor onboarding process.
Support “fast-buy” workflow for low-risk purchases (i.e. memberships), non-RFP renewal deals (low-dollar), catalog or PunchOut transactions to ensure effective turnaround time is maintained and internal customers and vendors have excellent procurement experience.
Provide regular reporting metrics and monitor various input/output activities (i.e., after the fact POs, number of POs crafted, number of invoices without POs, etc.)
Help drive the continuous improvement of the procurement function; design controls, training, support audits, new hire training and supervise our procurement requirements.
Your Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and minimum 5 years of combined procurement experience
Solid understanding of systems ideally Coupa, Dunn & Bradstreet, DocuSign, Concur, Dynamics etc.
Demonstrable experience managing ‘Fast Buy’ channels and preferred vendor programs and vendor PunchOuts, for expediting purchasing for low-risk commodities and vendors.
Thrive in working in a fast paced, environment and you are analytical, and data focused, you thrive on providing actionable insights via dashboard automation.
Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment while multi-tasking to meet multiple deadlines.
Must exhibit strong service excellence, detail oriented and excel in problem solving.
Must possess good judgment and meet ethical obligations to perform purchasing duties on behalf of the foundation.
Must be able to legally work in the country where this position is located without visa sponsorship.
The typical salary range for this role is $73,400 to $136,500 USD. The exact offer will be determined by a variety of factors such as the candidate’s individual skills, qualifications, and experience relative to the requirements of the role.

Hiring Requirements
As part of our standard hiring process for new employees, employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background check.
Candidate Accommodations

Job Description:
Description




Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Location: Thurston County – Olympia, Washington-Remote
Closes: November 29th 2023
Salary: $6,939.00 - $9,332.00 Monthly

The Opportunity:
The Business Intelligence Analyst for Child Welfare acts as a statewide specialist and supports DCYF’s mission by providing experience on outcomes for children in DCYF’s child welfare system. This position will focus on conducting research and analysis, developing strategies, and providing consultation to different teams across the department. This position will also collaborate with child welfare and OIAA as well as IT staff and regional staff within DCYF to create products and visualizations that incorporate data elements at the level of children, families, providers, and systems to address permanency tops, trends, and analysis.

Some of what you will get to do:

Designs Extract Transform and Load (ETL) log specific to analytic needs.
Translate requirements into application prototypes.
Construct automated reports.
Create data to integrate reports into CA’s report navigation application.
Write, debug, and maintain code.
Lead requirements gathering sessions.
Document functional and technical report designs
Develop test scripts for different types of data validation activities that cover business and technical requirements.
Review existing or developed code to understand the technical implementation of the requirement.
Obtain, clean, prepare, and import data from disparate DCYF systems and data sets from external partners.
Identify relevant measures and data sets for permanency outcomes.
Provide expertise on relevant data as well as present case outcomes.
Primary contact with contracting external evaluators and conduit between permanency staff and evaluators.
Required Qualifications:
At least four years of IT experience such as consulting, analyzing, designing, coding, and/or maintaining software applications and/or databases, and providing technical support in Information Technology and at least three years of recent experience developing analytic data solutions using a Business Intelligence reporting tool.


Experience can be obtained concurrently

In addition to the requirements above, our ideal candidate will possess some or all of the following:

Two years of experience working with Star Schema Data Warehouse databases.
Three years of recent experience working with relational databases.
Three years of experience writing T-SQL.
Experience working with a variety of information systems and data files.
Experience testing complex analytic data products and analytic systems.
Experience using an automated flowcharting tool such as MS Visio.

Current resume detailing experience and education.

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Description
Salesforce Data Cloud is a fast-growing product in Salesforce. Data Cloud, our flagship innovation, harnesses the power of real-time data to reimagine the Customer 360, enabling businesses to create awe-inspiring customer interactions at scale. Salesforce is looking for a Senior Sales Strategy Analyst to support the Data Cloud organization, and play a crucial role in the success of this product and team.

Overview of the Role
As part of a high-performance, fast-paced, and collaborative team, your role will encompass all aspects of running a successful sales organization, which includes GTM (Go-To-Market) planning, growth strategy, sales forecasting, business operations, and data evaluation and analysis. You will work with sales leadership and cross-functional partners to provide a 360° view of the business and drive executive-level recommendations and tools that directly impact an industry-leading Sales team in the Data Cloud Operating Unit.

Successful candidates will be able to use data to drive insights, provide strategic recommendations, build scalable assets, and guide the charge on execution and organizational change. You will have the opportunity to combine intuition for business, innovative inquiry, insights from sales leaders, and curiosity to accomplish meaningful work to uncover trends and identify insights that deliver impact across the organization.

Sample projects and results range from evaluating worldwide market opportunities, building a scalable reporting infrastructure, supporting the creation of the product growth strategy, market segmentation, sales pipeline and key performance metric reviews.

These teams play a meaningful role in supporting sales leadership at the fastest ever growing Enterprise software company!

Responsibilities

Evaluate ongoing business performance against growth targets to support daily operations
Define, design, and interpret key performance metrics to deliver insights and recommendations
Triage and troubleshoot operational issues and optimize infrastructure/systems/processes for scale
Support extensive GTM planning process and pivotal initiatives through capacity planning, efficiency, review, market segmentation, quota/incentive design, and more
Collaborate cross-functionally with finance (budget, headcount planning), recruiting (hiring profile, seasonality), field enablement/programs, Employee Success, etc.
Develop and deliver presentations for senior executives

Preferred Skills
Experienced. 5+ years of professional experience in Sales Operations, Analytics, Finance, Statistics, or other related fields.
Analytical. Exceptional data analysis skills, including attention to detail and ability to manage various data points to achieve a common goal.
Technically Savvy. Experience with Tableau, Google Sheets, SQL
Flexible & Nimble. Ability to excel in a fast growing/fast paced environment, delivering with accuracy while managing deadlines.
Multi-Tasker. Ability to understand broader business and financial issues, juggle multiple projects and tasks, and communicate across various project stages and departments.
Organized. Proven project execution skills with a strong desire to document best practices and process improvements. Ability to see the bigger picture and prioritize accordingly.
Education . Degree or equivalent relevant experience required. Experience will be evaluated based on the core competencies for the role (e.g. extracurricular leadership roles, military experience, volunteer roles, work experience, etc.)

Are you ready to make a positive impact on clients, colleagues, and the global community? Do you value commitment, curiosity, continuous growth, compassion, community, and collaboration?

Join us at Brighton Jones; our purpose is to make the world a better place through our clients living richer lives. We are the largest RIA in the Pacific Northwest, headquartered in Seattle, with offices nationwide.

From the very start, we have been an award-winning organization. We’ve won dozens of Best Places to Work awards — including Seattle Business Magazine’s Best Companies to Work for 15 years in a row — to multiple national and regional Community Impact awards. We pride ourselves in our culture and giving back to our community.

We are industry leaders and pioneers in financial well-being with a focus on helping our clients align their wealth, passions, and purpose so they can pursue a happier, healthier, and more fulfilling life.

Our team-based, client-centric approach has fueled our growth over the last 20+ years, and we’re now 250 teammates strong and growing, serving more than 4,000 clients, and advising on over $19 billion+ in assets. Every teammate has a path to ownership in the firm.

We are looking for a talented Sr Salesforce Business Analyst to join our technology team to collaborate with our different lines of business to solve business problems using Salesforce. Your Role:
Serve as the technical leader and Salesforce subject matter expert for Salesforce projects
Define and work within all aspects of project delivery from requirements gathering, solution definition & design, implementation, and training/change management
Communicate effectively between technical and business stakeholders and manage multiple priorities and deadlines
Recommend Salesforce configuration changes including (but not limited to) Flows, Custom Fields, Page layouts, Record types, Custom Settings, Permission Groups/Sets, and more.
Coach and mentor technical and non-technical team members, e.g. business analysts, developers, data analysts
Manage the flow of data from Salesforce to our data warehouse and data visualization tools
Your Experience:
Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in Salesforce Sales/Service cloud or Financial Services Cloud
Strong knowledge and experience implementing of Salesforce configuration, e.g. case management, Einstein Conversation Insights, and pipeline management
College degree, or equivalent experience required
